website_summaries.verdict: It’s a simple solution that uses real chicken liver alongside a range of tried and true ingredients to promote ongoing joint health for cats of all ages.
pros: Soft and chewy chicken liver-flavored supplements
Includes hip and joint healthy ingredients like fish oil, chondroitin, and Perna canaliculus
cons: It’d be nice if there were more than 30 chews per bag

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful- Formula Change
customer_reviews.text: My cat previously loved these chews, however Pet Naturals unexpectedly changed the formula and now the new formula makes my cat vomit. The company changed the packaging, but did not make it clear that these are not the same as before (it should state it clearly on the package). There are cats with food allergies and sensitivities and customers should be able to trust that a brand will be forthcoming with ingredient changes. The ingredients are very different and some amounts/doses have changed (I've attached a side-by-side of the old (left) and new (right) ingredients). I am not going to buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: L's reviews

customer_reviews.title: My cat pooped blood after eating these
customer_reviews.text: The day after I gave my cat her first one of these treats she pooped blood. Since this was the only thing that had changed I didn't feed another one to her until two weeks later and again she pooped blood the next day. Took her to the vet and she was perfectly healthy otherwise, they suggested watching her and discontinuing these new treats and she has been absolutely fine since. Could be a coincidence but she only pooped blood twice in her life and it was after eating these treats both times..Cannot recommend these less and I would give them negative stars if I could for making my cat sick.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Angel

customer_reviews.title: Fish Flavor not a hit!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved the Chicken flavor BUT the company unexpectedly quit making that flavor==sucks. The product is now only available in fish flavor that the company says even finicky cats love. Well my cat isn't that finicky but she HATES the fish flavor favor. She has to have these chews every day along with her other meds so LOOKS LIKE I WILL BE LOOKING FOR A NEW JOINT CHEW BRAND for my cat. Also took several emails and two phone calls to get the company to fess up that they didn't make the Chicken liver flavor anymore. This company had my business initially but they've sure lost me as a customer now!!
customer_reviews.author: K. J. Hueser

customer_reviews.title: Cats don't eat them!
customer_reviews.text: I have three indoor cats. I bought these for my 10 year old cat. She wouldn't even touch them, just sniffed them and walked away. I thought, well, my other two 3 year old rescue cats eat everything so they won't go to waste. WRONG! They too, after checking them out, just walked away from them. That is a first for those two. I even tried breaking one up in the older cats food and she somehow ate around them or spit them out because they remained in the bowl. Three cats give these a thumbs down!
customer_reviews.author: pogomaxx

customer_reviews.title: Great for mild RA for older cats
customer_reviews.text: I have an older cat with RA and can see a difference in the ease of movement in the winter months especially. One drawback is these treats are really hard, I have to leave them in a container with some bread to soften them up enough for my cat to chew. I have purchased this brand multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this product.
customer_reviews.text: My package was delayed due to postal problem. Not sellers fault at all. However, my poor cat suffered while waiting. She was back to her crippled shelf with no running or jumping at all. She needed help getting up on the bed. We are finally in good shape now that we finally have her favorite treat/vitamins. I am so happy with this product. It helps my poor arthritic cat have a better lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: 50pinkys

customer_reviews.title: Helps my cat a lot!
customer_reviews.text: These have helped my elderly cat a lot. She runs around and plays much more than she used to. I do find that they affect her stool however. Once she had gotten the full joint effect (about 8 weeks) I cut her dose down to only one per day in order to find a balance between the joint pain and getting diarrhea. It worked out well, so she gets all the joint benefits, while only having a somewhat soft stool.
customer_reviews.author: Saelon R.

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed that my cat wouldn't eat these joint supplements. Needs taste improvement.
customer_reviews.text: My cat hates these and won't eat them, so I can't say if they would help his joints. I know this doesn't seem like a fair review, but if the maker of this product wanted cats to eat it, it should taste good to them. I even tried to trick him by putting some of his Temptations Treats on top of one of the supplements, but he didn't fall for. He really doesn't like the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Celest

customer_reviews.title: What a difference
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 16 years old and has had hip and joint pain the last few years that has made it hard for her to jump and get around. I started to give her these treats a few months ago and it has made a huge difference. She is jumping on to and off of stuff again. She seems more comfortable and can jump up on the bed again. I am extremely happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: January Joy Huckins

customer_reviews.title: I'm very grateful that my wonderful pet has been helped by this supplement
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few supplements my cat can, and will eat on a regular basis. They have helped her right shoulder enough that she has been able to get up and down stairs much easier. I've even witnessed her running up and down the stairs a few times! I'm very grateful that my wonderful pet has been helped by this supplement.
customer_reviews.author: BB Kitty

customer_reviews.title: A great comfort for a suffering feline!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is part Maine Coon cat, and this breed has a tendency towards spinal degeneration. My poor fur-baby suffers from this condition, and at 10 years old has developed arthritis in her back and hips. This supplement has been a real God-send for this animal! Her pain seems to have been eliminated and she is getting about much easier.
customer_reviews.author: ADK-JAH

customer_reviews.title: Too many needed in one day, not enough per pack
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions on how many to give my cat a day, but ran out of the pack in about 2 weeks. If they made a bigger pack I'd consider buying them again because my cat ate them enthusiastically, but it's too expensive with only getting half a month of supply per pack
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did they change something in the ingredients? This last ...
customer_reviews.text: Did they change something in the ingredients? This last batch I ordered, neither of my cats will eat them. I have to break them up and disguise them in wet food.
customer_reviews.author: cat

customer_reviews.title: Getting old is not for the weak
customer_reviews.text: We started purchasing these treats for our little girl kitty who was 18. Over time we started giving them to the older male who is 12. We have recently lost our sweet Maya but I believe she was more comfortable till the end due to the help her little joints got from these treats. She had arthritis the last few years and these seemed to help her move around better.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy L. Farrar

customer_reviews.title: Tasty to my cat! Hope it's effective!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product on my ailing cat for the first time today so I can't yet rate how it works; but I will say this...My cat loved the flavor and gobbled 2 down! That doesn't seem like saying much but we've been to the vet 4 times already with Boo (Taboo) and they can't tell what's up with her. She has lost so much weight from deteriorated muscle mass. She needs exercise to build that up again. She hardly eats. These, I'm hoping will ease her joints so she can play again and regain some mobility. I'll update this next month to let y'all know if it's effective.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L. Connelly

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: These supplements really help both of our cats with their overall feeling of well-being. I know this because they are both really old (19 and 22 in human years) and have frequent stiff bones/walking/jumping higher than a sofa issues. I notice that when they are actively taking these supplements (meaning we haven't run out), they walk better and seem more peppy. It's worth mentioning that they LOVE the taste. You'd think these were made of catnip or something. :-)
customer_reviews.author: T Jones in VA

customer_reviews.title: Cat's don't like them
customer_reviews.text: Tried to give it to 3 cat's 2 of which will eat anything... They hated these. I wish they didn't, but they couldn't even stand the smell of them. I can't stress it enough, they don't taste good to cats. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be softer, otherwise great product
customer_reviews.text: The treats seemed to work as intended and our cat enjoyed the flavor; however I had to break it into very small pieces for my cat to be able to eat it. The treat is a hard chew, not very soft.
customer_reviews.author: YoYoJimbo

customer_reviews.title: Definite signs of improvement.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but my 18 year old cat was showing signs of arthritis in her hips. I remembered when my mother's older dog was arthritic, she had given him special treats which immensely helped his condition. I ordered these and waited. Not only does she seem more lively, she spends more time with us instead of sleeping. She also loves the taste, so much so that I had to put them up where she can not get into them. I understand that cats are like humans in the regard that they each have individual tastes, but my cat thoroughly enjoys these. For the price you really can not beat these results.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Ohl

customer_reviews.title: Might not taste good to a cat but it might also be helping
customer_reviews.text: My cat I wanted to take these doesn't seem she cares for them but one of my cats will eat one sometimes, it's odd because they aren't usually picky but I will try again and try crushing them up in their food.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spain

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: My very picky cat loves these and they seem to be helping her stiff joints. She is a but plump and on a diet, but at 14 her joints bother her and these help her move with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes these
customer_reviews.text: My cat eats these right up. I give them to him with other joint supplements, and I figured these won’t hurt to add. My other cat doesn’t like the taste, but she’s picky with what she eats. If you’re looking for a single joint supplement, I’d go with Cosequin or something of the sort. Add these for a treat with benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Ann

customer_reviews.title: Woukd give these 6 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: I have a picky kitty with 3 legs that needs the joint support since all his weight is on one back leg. He loves the taste of these and meows until he gets them every morning. We saw a difference in his agility in about a month. He’s getting around much easier.
customer_reviews.author: meanwhile

customer_reviews.title: My cats did love them, but won't eat them any more?
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were awesome, my cats loved them at first, but now won't come near them. I have no idea why. did they help my older cat with her aches and pains? I have no idea. Would I recommend them to cat owners? I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Hart

customer_reviews.title: as cats do like to be picky
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to be helping my cat with his old achy joints. He only ate about a dozen of these though over the course of about a week before never wanting to touch them again. Not entirely blaming this brand of supplements though, as cats do like to be picky.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: My cats love the flavor. Even the picky cat that will only eat his dry food loves this.. This product has more Cosequin in it than the Cosequin Brand. This has 200mg of cosequin Cosequin brand product has125mg
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Kitty absolutely refused to eat!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea if these treats actually help with joint pain, because my kitty refused to touch them with a 10-foot pole! She is normally not a finicky eater, so these must be really offensive.
customer_reviews.author: LouiseN

customer_reviews.title: Frisky senior cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat seemed to take to them very well. She had been limping, and after a few days she stopped. She's been a lot more limber since we started the treats. Glad to see my senior cat acting frisky again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Cat hates them.
customer_reviews.text: Cat won't touch them- She LOVES the Pet naturals calming treats. She's offended these. She won't eat food they've touched. I tried to cover them in the powder from the other treats and they are still a no-go. They're much harder and rubberier than the calming treats and don't even smell like something she'd want to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Ayris

customer_reviews.title: Great price for monthly prevention of future hip pain!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if working,because I'm giving for preventative joint pain in future. Pack lasts a month plus until I get new package & price is great for health. She gets 1 per day & it's gone w/other vitamin treats. Soft beefy texture & smell.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Garten

customer_reviews.title: Picky Eaters would not touch!
customer_reviews.text: Neither of my cats will even touch these. I have tried this brand in other flavors before and they did not like. The texture is sort of a rubbery pellet with all uniform.
customer_reviews.author: Damfree

customer_reviews.title: Caused upset stomach
customer_reviews.text: These caused my older cat who will eat (& keep down) just about anything to throw up and then almost stop eating. Which is NOT like her at all, since her nickname is "Chunk". We discontinued use and went to another med, which seems to do her just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mjsv

customer_reviews.title: Cat does not like new flavor
customer_reviews.text: Our cat has never been finicky, she eats about anything you put in front of her. But this new flavor she will not touch. I have found another product that is chicken from another provider. I have always liked doing business with Pet Naturals of VT and hate leaving them but if my cat will not eat it something is wrong with the taste. Not sure who decided to fix something that was not broke and change the flavor, but I would think they could have at least had two flavors.....
customer_reviews.author: David W Gragson

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes em
customer_reviews.text: My 17 year old cat has alot more spunk thanks to these I think and she loves em but she actually loves sweets and these strangely smell like chocolate which put my other cat off cuz she doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Mel gal

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be helping kitty’s arthritis.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parent’s kittycat who is getting rather old and not as active as she used to be. Since they started giving her these treats, my folks said she seems more comfortable than she had been and she really likes them.
customer_reviews.author: Ctina D

customer_reviews.title: LOVE Pet Naturals!
customer_reviews.text: All their products --especially the chews, have worked wonderfully for my elderly cat and she finds the chew much more to her liking than food additives!
customer_reviews.author: Karel Kenney

customer_reviews.title: Hip and joint chews for cats
customer_reviews.text: My cat liked these hip and joint chews. Only 4 stars because I'm disappointed they are no long were available.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Was hopeful
customer_reviews.text: I have a very finicky cat. She caught on that it wasd medicine like and refused to eat it.
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: My cat wouldn't eat them
customer_reviews.text: These are soft and u can breaks them with my hands. I ended up breaking it into crumbs and sneaking them into wet food. I only did this because they seemed to give my old kitty some extra oomf. My kitty is super snobby about his treats so my search will continue.
customer_reviews.author: mistyds88

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with results
customer_reviews.text: I gave 4 pcs per day (as directed) to my 15 yr old cat- she loved the taste, but developed diarrhea- I stopped giving to her - she has arthritis and I’m also giving her omega drops My 14 yr old cat would not eat the treats
customer_reviews.author: Veraflmom

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves them
customer_reviews.text: Our bodies for my cat and he loved them. I thought they were a little too expensive so I bought a different kind next time. My cat won’t touch them so I had to switch back to these.
customer_reviews.author: Viebie's fan club

customer_reviews.title: Came in melted
customer_reviews.text: My cat seem to lile them... which is amazing; however they came in melted, like a paste and I dont know how many pieces am I giving to her. See pic.
customer_reviews.author: kiria

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: works but my cat does not like them had to put in her food
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Pettry

customer_reviews.title: Cat eats it.
customer_reviews.text: My cat eats it. that’s what matters. I was trying to give him pills before and he would have none of it. This he enjoys.
customer_reviews.author: ATUP

customer_reviews.title: I’ll buy again
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these treats. He stands by the pantry door waiting. He knows he gets his treats in the morning after he does his lap. If he hears the bag he gets excited. He seems to be much more mobile and have been able to look more of his body when cleaning himself. I’ll continue to use these products
customer_reviews.author: rfarrell

customer_reviews.title: I notice she moves more with theses
customer_reviews.text: My 20 year old cat has arthritis and this joint supplement helps her move and feel more at ease. We have been using this one for 8 months now. and she LOVES the taste.
customer_reviews.author: meisa

customer_reviews.title: Treats for Pixie 😸
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves them She is a picky senior so I m thrilled she likes the taste of the and takes no time to eat them up
customer_reviews.author: M. Albrit

customer_reviews.title: She has healed up and plays like a kitten again
customer_reviews.text: I started my senior Maine Coon cat on this product about 9 months ago when she was having a hip issue from an injury. She has healed up and plays like a kitten again. My experience says this product works!
customer_reviews.author: Mombot1

customer_reviews.title: Cats did not eat these
customer_reviews.text: Cats did not like this at all. I have (6) and not one of them wanted it.

customer_reviews.title: If your cat is a picky eater, might not work
customer_reviews.text: If my cats would eat them it may be beneficial, but they are picky
customer_reviews.author: Terrie V.

customer_reviews.title: Pet Naturals Hip and Joint Supplement
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats. Two younger cats like these treats. My 16 yr old cat, who really likes to eat and who needs these treats, doesn't care for them. They are fairly big and harder than their regular treats so I broke them up, but that did not help.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger Tail

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: These are too expensive for the amount you get and my cat will not eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth DiGiammarino

customer_reviews.title: Pet Naturals Hip & Joint Vitamin Treats for cats.
customer_reviews.text: I was told these are good for cats with arthritis. I have a 15yr old male, big Ragamuffin about 15-17 lbs, who's been meowing more than usual, they must work because he's always under my feet and not meowing, unless it's Feeding Time!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Wish you hadn't changed the formula or manufacturing process.
customer_reviews.text: I used to love these, because my cats used to love these. Now, as others have said, the smell and texture has changed and they won't eat them. Switched to VetriScience brand and they eat them up.
customer_reviews.author: Hashu Deikus

customer_reviews.title: Not for picky cats
customer_reviews.text: Cats didnt like these. I threw them out. Would have given 5 stars if they did and I didnt waste my money.

customer_reviews.title: Auto Shipped Stale Goods
customer_reviews.text: I use these supplements for my cat. She loves them. But I ordered on auto ship from this vendor and both times the supplements arrived stale and hard as a rock. My cat wasn’t eating them anymore and I checked and that’s why. It doesn’t arrive fresh on auto ship. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: VT hip and joint
customer_reviews.text: I don' t really know if it works. Our cat is not communicating with us. But he does apparently enjoy the flavor for he gobbles them up .

customer_reviews.title: Our cat wouldnt touch them
customer_reviews.text: She turned her nose up. It's a gamble you take. Not like I can try them. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Dunn

customer_reviews.title: This has worked really, really well for my 14 ...
customer_reviews.text: This has worked really, really well for my 14 year old cat. She could hardly get around before we started it. She will not eat it as a treat so I break it into smaller pieces and mix with her canned food. Started with 4 a day as advised and then cut down to 2.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Not all cats will eat these.
customer_reviews.text: Only 1 cat of of 3 will eat these. I tried to hide them in tuna and food. the will not be fooled.

customer_reviews.text: These tidbits are eagerly eaten by my old cat. She seems to move a little more easily with an improved mood!

customer_reviews.title: Winner
customer_reviews.text: My Himalayan cat loves these and they help him pass hair balls. I had a minor problem with an order and the company was responsive and fixed it right away. Recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: No Sale

customer_reviews.title: The only one that helps
customer_reviews.text: This is the only product like this, that my oldest cat will eat. It seemed to help her right away. She is running around the house more, something I have not seen her do in a while; the price is a little high but it helps her.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These little chews have really helped my overweight kitty regain his mobility.

customer_reviews.title: good product - seems to be working
customer_reviews.text: cat loves them and is happy to eat them every day. I really think it helps her hip problem

customer_reviews.text: My cat will not eat these like treats but if I cut one up really fine and put it in her pate cat food she will eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Kraft Lady

customer_reviews.title: I was worried he wouldn't enjoy them but he loves them and gets very excited ...

I was worried he wouldn't enjoy them but he loves them and gets very excited for his treats every day. So far I have seen slight differences in his behaviors with jumping and climbing and I am hopeful that he will continue to feel less pain when jumping.

customer_reviews.text: My cat is old so the doctor recommended buying these for her. She loves them, I think she loves them too much. She goes crazy for these treats.

customer_reviews.text: The bag I received must have been old. The treats are hard as rocks and my cats won't come near them. Not the same quality as I get at the vet's office

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my cats really like this product and it does seem to help

customer_reviews.title: Buy your pet meds locally.
customer_reviews.text: They were hard, they said moist on package 📦 cat would not eat them.
customer_reviews.author: BONNIE  VERMILLION

customer_reviews.title: They used to be under $5 and worked great for our cat
customer_reviews.text: Wish the company didn't double the price on these. They used to be under $5 and worked great for our cat. Now we have to look at alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah B.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Normally this product is soft and chewable. The latest purchase is hard as a rock.
customer_reviews.author: Janel McCann

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it and I see a major improvement in them
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it and I see a major improvement in them! They think it's time for a treat and they eat it right up
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Alexa

customer_reviews.title: My cat loved the original but want's nothing to do with this ...
customer_reviews.text: Not even close to the original. It smells different and the texture is different. My cat loved the original but want's nothing to do with this version. Want to them for changing because after my cat refused to eat and I couldn't even trick her by mixing it in her food, it led me to this product which is amazing and the answer to getting my cat to eat it:  I can sprinkle that on her favorite treats and she doesn't even know it's there. Stuff is odorless and tasteless.
customer_reviews.author: Effy

product_meta.title: Pet Naturals - Hip + Joint for Cats, Daily Hip & Joint Support Supplement, 30 Chews
product_meta.description: Hip + joint for cats is an easy way to tackle joint health issues in our feline friends. Formulated by VETERINARIANS, this supplement is designed for cats that are showing signs of aging and discomfort in their daily activities. Signs can include avoiding being picked up, inability to use the litter box, trouble with stairs or just a change in energy levels during play. With recognized joint support ingredients like Glucosamine and Chondroitin And the inclusion of perna Canaliculus a whole food Mussel, you can feel good about choosing Pet Naturals for your pet.
feature_bullets: Ingredients you trust: hip + joint includes joint supporting ingredients Glucosamine, Chondroitin, MSM and Perna Canaliculus
Helps keep cats playful: recommended for cats that are showing signs of joint discomfort and stiffness, having trouble jumping, moving laying down or getting up
Cat specific Flavor: delicious fish Flavor that even finicky cats will love
No artificial ingredients: hip + joint chews are free of wheat, corn and artificial ingredients
Veterinarian formulated: formulated and manufactured in the USA with support from our Veterinary review board
